name: dado
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the lower part of the wall inside a room, when this is painted a different colour or covered in different paper from the upper part: We've painted the dado a dark mulberry colour and the rest of the wall off-white. See also
dado rail
short for
dado rail : a long, thin, decorative piece of wood fixed about halfway up a wall, separating the wall into two parts: You can make a room look larger, or smaller, by altering the level of dados and picture rails. The bath has been panelled and the walls tiled up to dado height.
US a long cut that is made into a piece of wood, which the edge of another piece of wood is fixed into: Cut dadoes in the sides of the chest for the joints with the bottom panel. a dado blade/joint
More examplesFewer examplesI removed layers and layers of wallpaper until I reached the original varnished paper dado.Imitation marble is sometimes used for columns, dadoes, etc. This 1900 pub has a tongue-and-groove dado, above which the walls are covered with glazed tiles.Spread glue in the dadoes in the top shelves.We built the drawers using a locking joint between the face and sides, and a dado joint at the back.
